A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
While not having the impact of The Force Awakens\, Rian Johnson's sequel takes the well written and engaging characters J.J Abrams introduced and takes them\, for the most part\, in interesting and exciting new directions.

This movie rights the major flaw of TFA in that it stands very much on it's own and does not just repeat the story beats of Empire\, but it is not itself flawless. I found the character of Finn to be largely underserved and was not too keen on where his story went for the middle act of the film. Although the setting here was pretty cool to see in a Star Wars movie\, and it cast shades of grey upon the inhabitants of the galaxy\, I didn't find the action scenes or overall progression of events worked all that well.

The new characters of Rose and Holdo in particular I thought were welcome additions\, with Laura Dern specifically standing out.

The action set pieces are as fantastic and exhilarating as you would expect\, but many of them carry an immediacy and emotional heft to them which was somewhat missing from TFA.

The characters of Rey and Poe are well served. They face challenges which make them question not only themselves\, but the things they believe to be true about the world around them.

Adam Driver as Kylo Ren is once again the scene stealer. I found everything he done to be fascinating. He is such a fantastic character and Driver's performance is excellent.

It's a more ambitious film than it's predecessor\, with more to say (capitalism\, war profiteering\, the problems of dogmatic religions) and more risks to take with characters we know and love\, but tries to juggle a few too many balls at once.

I have deliberately not said anything about Luke here\, because I think that's better to see without any preconceived ideas. I'll just say that I really liked what they did with him\, and the overall theme of legends and heroes and the reality of such things worked well all throughout the film.

I even welled up at a few points. Rest in Peace\, Carrie Fisher.
